elements.name: Intro
elements.html: We are interested in learning about all facilitators' experiences during Day 2 of the 2021 Summit. Your responses will be shared anonymously with Code.org staff and co-leads running these workshops to help inform summits and other professional learning opportunities in the future. Thank you for taking a few minutes to complete this survey!

elements.name: Course
elements.title: For which course did you attend the Summit?

elements.name: cohort-CSP
elements.title: Which Cohort were you a part of?
elements.description: Please visit /bit.ly/ if you are unsure.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which Cohort were you a part of?
elements.description: Please visit /bit.ly/ if you are unsure.

elements.name: iFeelCSP
elements.title: I feel more prepared to lead Code.org's CS Principles Professional Learning workshops in 2021-22 than I did before today.

elements.name: iFeelCSD
elements.title: I feel more prepared to lead Code.org's CS Discoveries Professional Learning workshops in 2021-22 than I did before today.

elements.name: usefulPractice
elements.title: What was the most useful thing you learned today and why?

elements.name: overallTo
elements.title: Overall, to what extent did you find the activities today engaging?
elements.description: (1) Not at all engaging - (7) Very engaging

elements.name: whatWas93
elements.title: What was most engaging for you today?

elements.name: whatWas94
elements.title: What was least engaging for you today?

elements.name: choiceSessionNew1
elements.title: This is the first time we’ve offered a “choice session” at a facilitator development event. How satisfied were you with the variety of choices offered for this session?

elements.name: choiceSessionNew2
elements.title: Would you recommend that we offer a similar opportunity at future facilitator development events?

elements.name: choiceSessionNew3
elements.title: If we were to offer choice sessions at future facilitator development events, how likely would you be to accept the opportunity to lead a choice session.

elements.name: newQuestion1
elements.title: I can describe how equity is supported throughout the summer workshop.

elements.name: newQuestion2
elements.title: I can describe strategies I will use to support equity throughout the summer workshop.

elements.name: newQuestion3
elements.title: I can identify facilitation practices I need to strengthen in support of leading high-quality, equity-focused CS workshops.

elements.name: overallTo52
elements.title: Overall, to what extent are you feeling connected to the facilitator community after this event?
elements.description: (1) Not at all connected - (7) Very connected

elements.name: newQuestion4
elements.title: To what extent has your experience at this event supported your understanding of the role and opportunity you have as a Code.org facilitator to support equity in your workshops?
elements.description: (1) Not at all - (7) To a great extent

elements.name: newQuestion5
elements.title: During this event, we asked you to identify a commitment you are making as a facilitator this year in support of equity. Please share that commitment here.

elements.name: ifThere23
elements.title: If there is anything you would like us to know, please use this space to share.

elements.name: permission
elements.title: I give Code.org permission to quote my written feedback from today for use on social media, promotional materials, and other communications.

choices.text: Yes, I give Code.org permission to quote me and use my name.
Yes, I give Code.org permission to quote me, but I want to be anonymous.
No, I do not give Code.org my permission.

elements.name: question2
elements.html: Thank you for sharing your responses! If you have any questions about this survey, please contact facilitators@code.org.
